titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for T. Lindsay Baker Papers, 1949-1990 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
T. Lindsay Baker Papers,
1949-1990 and undated
did.abstract: The papers of T. (Thomas) Lindsay Baker concerning Polish Americans and windmills.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: T. (Thomas) Lindsay Baker received his B.A., M.A. and Ph.D. degrees in history at Texas Tech University. He conducted extensive work in both the history of technology and social and cultural history, and published several books in those areas. Baker also served as a curator at museums in Canyon, Fort Worth and Waco, Texas. The Westerners International is a foundation whose purpose is to encourage interest and research in frontier history. T. Lindsay served as president at one time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes professional and personal correspondence, manuscripts of The First Polish Americans, A Field Guide to American Windmills, and Silesians in Texas, some photographs and printed materials, scrapbook materials and files on the Westerners International and the Inner Ear Coffeehouse of Lubbock, Texas.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: T. Lindsay Baker Papers, 1949-1990 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:
